content.question: The Gates is similar to other large-scale, twentieth-century public sculptures, such as Claes Oldenburgâ€™s original version of Lipstick (Ascending) on Caterpillar Tracks, in that it was

choices.label: created to communicate a specific political message
rearranged and reassembled in different locations to reach greater audiences
funded entirely by public donations to increase civic engagement
conceived as being temporary to enhance the dramatic effect

content.answer: conceived as being temporary to enhance the dramatic effect

topic.text: 10.1: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Global Contemporary Art

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Explain how two or more works of art are similar and/or different in how they convey meaning.
